Methods

AdjustSaturation(float)

Adjusts the saturation of the current Color.

public Color AdjustSaturation(float adjustment)

Parameters

adjustment float

A value between -1 and 1. Negative values decrease saturation, and positive values increase it.

Returns

Color

The Color with adjusted saturation.

Equals(Color)

Determines whether the current color object is equal to another color object.

public bool Equals(Color other)

Parameters

other Color

The color to compare to.

Returns

bool

True if the current color object is equal to the other color object; otherwise, false.

Determines whether the current color object is equal to another color object.

public override bool Equals(object? obj)

Parameters

obj object

The color to compare to.

Returns

bool

FromHsv(float, float, float)

Creates a new Color instance from the specified HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value) model values.

public static Color FromHsv(float hue, float saturation, float value)

Parameters

hue float

The hue component of the color, in degrees (0-360).

saturation float

The saturation component of the color, as a value between 0 and 1.

value float

The value (brightness) component of the color, as a value between 0 and 1.

Returns

Color

A new Color object representing the specified HSV color.

GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for this instance.

public override int GetHashCode()

Returns

int

The hash code for this instance.

Invert(bool)

Returns the inverted color, with an option to maintain the alpha component.

public Color Invert(bool keepAlpha = true)

Parameters

keepAlpha bool

Specifies whether to retain the original alpha value. If set to false, the alpha value will also be inverted.

Returns

Color

A new Color instance with the RGB components inverted, and the alpha component either retained or inverted based on the keepAlpha value.

ToHsv()

Converts the current color to its HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value) representation.

public (float Hue, float Saturation, float Value) ToHsv()

Returns

(float Hue, float Saturation, float Value)

A tuple containing the Hue, Saturation, and Value components of the color.

ToRgbaFloat()

Converts the color to an RgbaFloat value.

public RgbaFloat ToRgbaFloat()

Returns

RgbaFloat

A new instance of the RgbaFloat struct representing the color.

ToRgbaFloatVec4()

Converts the color to a Vector4 representation with each component normalized to the range of 0 to 1.

public Vector4 ToRgbaFloatVec4()

Returns

Vector4

A Vector4 object representing the normalized RGBA components of the color.

ToString()

Returns a string that represents the current color.

public override string ToString()

Returns

string

A string representation of the current color.

ToVector4()

Converts the color to a Vector4 representation.

public Vector4 ToVector4()

Vector4

Operators

operator +(Color, Color)

Adds two colours together piece-wise.

public static Color operator +(Color left, Color right)

Parameters

left Color

The first color to add.

right Color

The second color to add.

Returns

Color

A Color that is the result of adding the two colors together.

operator /(Color, Color)

Implements the division operator for the Color structure.

public static Color operator /(Color left, Color right)

Parameters

left Color

The Color instance acting as the dividend.

right Color

The Color instance acting as the divisor.

Returns

Color

A new Color resulting from component-wise division of the two colors. If a component in the divisor is zero, the resulting component is clamped to 255.

operator ==(Color, Color)

Determines whether two Color objects are equal.

public static bool operator ==(Color left, Color right)

Parameters

left Color

The first Color to compare.

right Color

The second Color to compare.

Returns

bool

true if the specified Color objects are equal; otherwise, false.

Represents the equality operator for comparing two colors for equality.

public static bool operator !=(Color left, Color right)

Parameters

left Color

The first color to compare.

right Color

The second color to compare.

Returns

bool

true if the colors are equal; otherwise, false.

operator %(Color, Color)

Computes the component-wise remainder (modulo) of two colors, treating each channel separately.

public static Color operator %(Color left, Color right)

Parameters

left Color

The left operand representing the dividend color.

right Color

The right operand representing the divisor color.

Returns

Color

A new Color representing the component-wise remainder.

operator *(Color, Color)

Multiplies the color components of two Color instances component-wise.

public static Color operator *(Color left, Color right)

Parameters

left Color

The first Color instance.

right Color

The second Color instance.

Returns

Color

A new Color resulting from the component-wise multiplication of the two input colors.

public static Color operator -(Color left, Color right)

Parameters

left Color

The first color to subtract.

right Color

The second color to subtract.

Returns

Color

A Color that is the result of subtracting the two colors together.
